key_work.title: Toupie-fantoche (Spinning Top)
key_work.brief_description: Charles-Émile Reynaud wasn’t content with only inventing the praxinoscope. In 1881 he simplified his own design, creating a new portable optical toy called the toupie-fantoche, or ‘spinning top’. Typical scenes included butterflies fluttering, dogs jumping through hoops and drummer boys drumming.

constellations_other.name: Movies in movies in a movie museum
constellations_other.description: The 400 Porto-Arc 16mm projector used the first electric light ever invented, which was perfectly suited for movie projectors. This Constellation explores the movies where characters go to the movies, by two movie-obsessed directors.

recommendations.quote: De Niro’s Travis Bickle is one of the key figures of American cinema; the passage of his taxi through the grubby, smoky streets of the city – accompanied by the great composer Bernard Herrmann’s final score – are unforgettable.  So are his improvised monologues - "Are you talking to me?”

links.description: Mirrors also play an important role in the character arch of Travis Bickle in Taxi Driver yet rather than saving Bickle, encapsulating his decent into violence. Bickle appears fractured between the macho man in the mirror and his real self who is instead lost and lonely.
